result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Eric A Johnson was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $692 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections. Def can reduce fine by $300 by providing proof of payment of assessment to Clerk of Courts.
Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent or with alcohol in system.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply. Credit DOES apply.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric A Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Eric A Johnson.  Attorney Kyle Olsen for Benjamin Wagner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

 IN CUSTODY

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 2   . 


COUNT #  1  
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years cc to ES in case 19CF376 (Dane Co)

CONDITIONS:
-Serve  130 days in DCJ, w/Huber and good time, to commence f/w 
-Do not drive a MV w/o valid DL & agent approval
-do not drive MV with alcohol in system
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 1
$600 Fine + cc
-All CC and DNA surcharge waived. Fine + V/W surcharge due on probation
Defn can reduce fine by $300 by providing proof of payment of assessment to Clerk of Courts

-Revocation of driver's license for 36  months 
-Ignition Interlock Device required upon licensure for  36  months
-1/2 Price IID
-AODA assessment

CREDIT:
-Days credit for time served: 95 days
-Days credit for conditional jail: 95 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Lindsey B/Emailed to DOC

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 19, 2022 at 08:45 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

10:05 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Waiver of Prelim on June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

02:19 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
